content: आहार्य {%<ab>pot. p.</ab>%} {@--1@} To be taken or seized. {@--2@} To be fetched or brought near. {@--3@} To be extracted or removed. {@--4@} To be pervaded (व्याप्य). {@--5@} Artificial, adventitious, incidental, external, accessory; आहार्यशोभारहितैरमायैः <ls>Bk. 2. 14</ls>; न रम्यमाहार्यमपेक्षते गुणं <ls>Ki. 4. 23</ls>; निसर्गसुभगस्य किमाहार्यकाडंबरेण <ls>Malli.</ls> on <ls>Ku. 7. 20.</ls> {@--6@} Purposed, intended (as for instance, the identification or आरोप of उपमान or उपमेय in रूपक of which the speaker is fully cognisant); अयं चंद्रो मुखभित्यादौ चंद्रभिन्ने मुखे चंद्राभेदज्ञानं तच्चाहार्यमेव <ls>Tv.</ls> {@--7@} Conveyed or effected by decoration or ornamentation, one of the 4 kinds of अभिनय <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--8@} To be eaten. {@--9@} To be worshipped (as Agni). --र्यः A kind of bandage (बंध). --र्यं {@--1@} Any disease to be treated by means of extracting. {@--2@} Extraction. {@--3@} A vessel. {@--4@} The ornamentative part of the drama, such as dress, decorations &c.
